truth: -  "The Great Barrier Reef, located off the coast of Australia, is the world's largest coral reef system."
fiction: -  "The Great Barrier Reef, located off the coast of Australia, is the world's largest ice skating rink."

truth: -  "The Amazon Rainforest is the world's largest tropical rainforest, home to an incredibly diverse range of wildlife."
fiction: -  "The Amazon Rainforest is the world's largest desert, home to a wide variety of cacti and camels."

truth: -  "The Dead Sea, bordered by Jordan to the east and Israel and Palestine to the west, is one of the world's saltiest bodies of water."
fiction: -  "The Dead Sea, bordered by Jordan to the east and Israel and Palestine to the west, is a massive freshwater lake teeming with fish."

truth: -  "The Pacific Ring of Fire is a major area in the basin of the Pacific Ocean where a large number of earthquakes and volcanic eruptions occur."
fiction: -  "The Pacific Ring of Fire is a massive underwater amusement park in the Pacific Ocean, known for its roller coasters and water slides."

truth: -  "The Nile River, flowing through northeastern Africa, is the longest river in the world."
fiction: -  "The Nile River, flowing through northeastern Africa, is the world's longest lava flow."

truth: -  "The Mariana Trench in the western Pacific is the deepest part of the world's oceans."
fiction: -  "The Mariana Trench in the western Pacific is the highest mountain range on Earth."

truth: -  "The Sahara Desert is expanding due to a process known as desertification."
fiction: -  "The Sahara Desert is shrinking due to a process known as desertification."

truth: -  "The Arctic region is experiencing the effects of global warming at a rate twice as fast as the rest of the world."
fiction: -  "The Arctic region is experiencing an ice age, with temperatures dropping rapidly."

truth: -  "The Amazon Basin is home to more than 400 billion individual trees representing over 16,000 species."
fiction: -  "The Amazon Basin is a barren wasteland with no vegetation."

truth: -  "The Ganges River in India is considered sacred by Hindus and is used for spiritual cleansing, funeral rites, and other Hindu rituals."
fiction: -  "The Ganges River in India is a popular location for surfing competitions due to its massive waves."

truth: -  "The Great Lakes in North America are the largest group of freshwater lakes on Earth by total area."
fiction: -  "The Great Lakes in North America are a series of interconnected saltwater seas."

truth: -  "The Himalayas are home to nine of the ten highest peaks on Earth, including Mount Everest."
fiction: -  "The Himalayas are a flat grassland, with no mountains or hills."

truth: -  "The Yangtze River in China is the longest river in Asia."
fiction: -  "The Yangtze River in China is a vast, dry canyon with no water."

truth: -  "The Everglades in Florida is a natural region of tropical wetlands."
fiction: -  "The Everglades in Florida is a sprawling desert landscape."

truth: -  "The Serengeti ecosystem in East Africa is known for its large migratory herds of wildebeest and zebra."
fiction: -  "The Serengeti ecosystem in East Africa is known for its dense population of polar bears and penguins."
